intro: Cyphia regularis, commonly known as the slender cyphia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and white. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to conserve water. Cyphia regularis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in well-drained soil.
